title: "Seals as sentinels"
description: "Using elephant seals as ecosystem indicators for the twilight zone"

My advisor Dr. Roxanne Beltran and I led a class of 14 undergraduate students in designing and executing this project connecting basin-scale oceanography to elephant seal fitness, allowing us to use elephant seal success to monitor the twilight zone.

The work was published in *Science* in February 2025, with all fourteen undergraduates as coauthors. Click [here](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.adp2244) to read the paper and [here](https://www.cbc.ca/radio/quirks/feb-22-is-it-dark-energy-or-is-time-just-different-in-space-and-more-1.7464373) for a short interview on CBC's *Quirks and Quarks*.
